description: This class focuses on defining, classifying, analyzing, interpreting, evaluating, and understanding literature. Students study both practical criticism (discussion of particular works or writers) and theoretical criticism (principles and criteria appropriate to literature generally). The course introduces a broad range of critical theories and provides an historical overview of the subject. Prerequisites: English 185 plus one additional course relevant background.
name: Literary Crit/Theory
prerequisites: Prerequisites: English 185 plus one additional course relevant background.
title: Literary Criticism and Theory
